intro: Rhabdotosperma schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian milk bush, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its succulent, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature and can be used in traditional medicine. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
